examples: She won the admiration of many people in her battle against cancer.
The athlete's record-breaking performance in the championship game knocked his opponents out of the park, securing his place in history and earning him widespread admiration and respect.
After reading her biography, I saw her accomplishments in a different light and gained a deeper admiration for her resilience and determination.
John witnessed how a known scam artist was treated with respect and admiration once he had made a fortune through his shady dealings.
She had always admired the celebrity from afar, but after meeting them in person, she realized that admiration is the daughter of ignorance - she had not known the person behind the public persona.
words.defineEn: a feeling of much respect for and approval of someone or something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác rất tôn trọng và chấp thuận của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: She admired the intricate design and embroidery on the toe of her handmade slippers.
He admired the hand-painted design on the teacup.
He admired her intelligence and kind-hearted nature.
He admired the vibrant colors of the leafy plants in his garden.
She admired the artwork displayed in the museum.
words.defineEn: to express respect toward a person for their act
words.defineVi: để thể hiện sự tôn trọng đối với một người cho hành động của họ

examples: The CEO and the marketing director are in each other's pocket, resulting in biased and unbalanced strategies for the company.
People are so biased about everything.
He's pretty biased.
But, of course, we’re super biased about what’s plausible.
Sometimes, this can lead to bad judgments and biased opinions.
words.defineEn: tending to be for or against someone or something in an unfair way
words.defineVi: có xu hướng ủng hộ hoặc chống lại ai đó hoặc điều gì đó một cách không công bằng

examples: She couldn't hide her grimace of disgust when she tasted the spoiled milk.
The student couldn't hide his disgust and grimaced when he saw the grade on his test.
No, they were disgusted.
Or you might learn disgust from others.
So disgust can help mold individual values and biases.
words.defineEn: a strong feeling of distaste for someone or something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác chán ghét mạnh mẽ cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: The chef tasted the sauce with a small spoon.
The pith of the citrus fruit added a bitter taste to the juice.
The sauce would kill the taste of the herbs.
Too much garlic killed the taste of the meat.
The cake tasted so good that everyone wanted a second slice.
words.defineEn: the ability to recognize something with good quality or high standard, especially in art, style, beauty, etc.
words.defineVi: khả năng nhận ra một cái gì đó với chất lượng tốt hoặc tiêu chuẩn cao, đặc biệt là về nghệ thuật, phong cách, vẻ đẹp, v.v.

examples: Remember to always adjust the quantity of yeast extract according to your taste preferences.
The human resources manager understood that her employees had varying needs and preferences, and created a flexible work environment to accommodate them - different strokes for different folks.
We hosted a barbecue party, considering everyone's steak preferences, grilling a mix of medium rare and well-done steaks for different tastes.
Many tortoises have color preferences.
Chameleons actually have taste preferences.
words.defineEn: a strong liking or inclination towards something or someone over others
words.defineVi: một ý thích mạnh mẽ hoặc khuynh hướng đối với một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó hơn những người khác

examples: Pop is a feast to the ears of many, but I despise it.
James' teacher wanted to impart the wisdom of the ages to his students, so he often said that the fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Others despise it.
And lastly, I despise cold weather.
He just despises you now, yeah.
words.defineEn: to hate and have no respect for something or someone
words.defineVi: để ghét và không có sự tôn trọng cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: McConnell, as much as I detest him, delivered that.
McConnell, as much as I detest him, delivered that.
words.defineEn: to absolutely hate someone or something
words.defineVi: để hoàn toàn ghét một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: It's not for me to pass judgement on your behaviour.
Bob persuaded her to go by car, against her better judgement, and she regretted it as soon as she saw the heavy traffic.
I can feel, I can feel your judgement.
Everyone's going to have certain judgements that they are going to think.
But that is that inner judgement in your head.
words.defineEn: an opinion that is formed after thinking carefully
words.defineVi: một ý kiến được hình thành sau khi suy nghĩ cẩn thận

examples: The court found in her favor.
The ambassador curried favor with the dictator by praising his construction projects.
I favor anything that tilts the scales in my direction.
They are doing their neighbor a favor by mowing their lawn.
do me a favor and stick a sock in it.
words.defineEn: to treat someone better than someone else, especially in an unfair manner
words.defineVi: đối xử với ai đó tốt hơn người khác, đặc biệt là theo cách không công bằng

examples: Find a hobby.
After all, love will find a way.
Water will always find its own level.
She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
The court found in her favor.
words.defineEn: (of a law court) to make an official decision
words.defineVi: (của tòa án) đưa ra quyết định chính thức

examples: Shadberries add visual appeal and a delicate texture to dishes.
Different genres of music appeal to different people, and for me, classical music really floats my boat.
Police have appealed for witnesses, but it seems the locals are keeping shtum.
The Court of Appeal held that there was no evidence to support the judge's assessment.
I enjoy the vibrant colors of sweet peppers in my salad, as they add a visual appeal to the dish.
words.defineEn: the attraction and allure that makes one interesting
words.defineVi: sự hấp dẫn và quyến rũ làm cho một người thú vị

examples: She adores her little alligator pouch.
I absolutely adore these two bowties!
I adore him.
I just adore to work.
and I just have adored every second of this journey.
words.defineEn: to love and respect someone very much
words.defineVi: yêu và tôn trọng ai đó rất nhiều

examples: Pass the salt, please.
Please make a note of the dates.
Close the door, please.
Can I have a Coke, please?
Please write your name on the paper.
words.defineEn: to make someone satisfied or happy
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó hài lòng hoặc hạnh phúc

examples: That contest wasn't fair!
You don't have a prayer in this contest.
The battle lines were drawn yesterday for the fiercest contest in the history of local radio.
I know you worked really hard on this project, but it looks like your cake is dough, and you won't be winning the contest.
The trip to the beach cost me $100, but I almost broke even after winning $90 in a contest.
words.defineEn: to formally oppose or challenge a decision or a statement
words.defineVi: để chính thức phản đối hoặc thách thức một quyết định hoặc một tuyên bố

examples: So what locations meet these criteria?
Here's the criteria.
What is that criteria?
Most children also meet the criteria for Dysthymia.
Another possible criterion is the pace of our development.
words.defineEn: a principle or standard by which something is judged or decided
words.defineVi: một nguyên tắc hoặc tiêu chuẩn theo đó một cái gì đó được đánh giá hoặc quyết định

examples: The crime was committed in broad daylight.
The organization is committed to promoting equality and fairness for every person.
They have committed to a lifetime of love and partnership by getting married.
The government is committed to holding exports at their present level.
You should take a hard look at the issues before committing yourself.
words.defineEn: to be dedicated to a person, cause, policy, etc.
words.defineVi: được dành riêng cho một người, nguyên nhân, chính sách, vv

examples: This person is extremely inflexible in his thinking.
Basically, farmers are up against an inflexible food supply chain, which is specialized for the end customer.
They're urgent because they have inflexible deadlines.
It’s only when traits get really rigid and people become inflexible in their behaviors that psychologists start to draw the line between a trait and a disorder.
And number four: Is overconscientious scrupulous, and inflexible about matters of morality, ethics, or values.
words.defineEn: reluctant to compromise or change one's attitude, belief, plan, etc.
words.defineVi: miễn cưỡng thỏa hiệp hoặc thay đổi thái độ, niềm tin, kế hoạch, v.v.

examples: We all have free will.
But then, do I have free will?
There’s just no room for free will in this picture.
Research like this can even give us fresh insights into the nature of free will.
And to be clear, libertarian free will is nothing like political libertarianism.
words.defineEn: the idea that human beings have the agency to decide independently without being controlled by any outside influences
words.defineVi: ý tưởng rằng con người có cơ quan để quyết định một cách độc lập mà không bị kiểm soát bởi bất kỳ ảnh hưởng bên ngoài nào

examples: Still can't get over the idea that someone thought bullying real life children was an acceptable thing to do.
Pre-loaded bloatware looks pretty acceptable.
That's acceptable.
That's acceptable.
that's totally acceptable.
words.defineEn: capable of being approved
words.defineVi: có khả năng được phê duyệt

examples: After numerous inspections, the correct answer to this dilemma still remains at sea.
So, I understand national leaders' dilemma.
Now you see the dilemma?
Now people here are facing a new dilemma.
But now you and your partner face a dilemma.
words.defineEn: a situation that is difficult because a choice must be made between two or more options that are equally important
words.defineVi: một tình huống khó khăn vì phải lựa chọn giữa hai hoặc nhiều lựa chọn có tầm quan trọng như nhau

examples: In the end we reached a compromise.
The couple had to compromise and give and take in order to make their marriage work.
We should take the lead in proposing a compromise and be ready to give ground on several points.
The politician burned his boats by refusing to compromise on his position.
The artist refused to compromise on their vision for commercial success, understanding that no man loves his fetters, be they made of gold.
words.defineEn: a middle state between two opposing situations that is reached by slightly changing both of them, so that they can coexist
words.defineVi: một trạng thái trung gian giữa hai tình huống đối lập đạt được bằng cách thay đổi một chút cả hai, để chúng có thể cùng tồn tại

examples: We finally settled on a soft yellow for the kitchen walls.
The dust is settling on the chaos which ensued when the French sold 110,000 tickets to the World Cup football matches by phone.
You should let the dust settle before you make any big decisions.
I'll call you as soon as the dust settles from the move.
When the dust settled and the votes were recounted, she had won the election.
words.defineEn: to follow a more secure and stable lifestyle with a permanent job and home
words.defineVi: để theo một lối sống an toàn và ổn định hơn với một công việc lâu dài và nhà

examples: He's a tough customer, but with some persuasion, we were able to close the deal.
In relationships and negotiations, it's important to remember that persuasion is better than force.
We ran very, very little money for persuasion.
We ran an extremely minuscule amount of money into persuasion.
There's no persuasion.
words.defineEn: a set of personal beliefs mostly religious and political
words.defineVi: một tập hợp các niềm tin cá nhân chủ yếu là tôn giáo và chính trị

examples: They just had to convert magnetic attraction and repulsion into something else.
The quantum-mechanical repulsion of electrons is overcome, and electrons and protons fuse into neutrons packed as densely as an atomic nucleus.
The actual boop itself, the sensation of touch, is caused by an actual force from this repulsion, acting on pressure-sensitive nerves in my skin.
They imagine that dark matter exerts a previously unknown force that works kind of like magnetic repulsion.

That’s one obvious problem some cosmologists have with this hypothesis, especially because Farnes put the repulsion idea in there because he thought it made sense, rather than getting it from mathematical equations.
words.defineEn: intense hatred or disgust
words.defineVi: thù hận hoặc ghê tởm dữ dội

examples: she has a grudge for my father.
I don't think she's ever held a grudge in her life!
She bears a grudge against the judge who sentenced her.
Johnny has been holding a grudge against me since we were 12 because I embarrassed him in front of a girl he liked.
I don't want either of you bearing a grudge about this thing, no matter what happens.
words.defineEn: a deep feeling of anger and dislike toward someone because of what they did in the past
words.defineVi: một cảm giác tức giận sâu sắc và không thích ai đó vì những gì họ đã làm trong quá khứ

examples: Having to seek his foe's aid was a bitter pill to take.
Foe once Maggie's acting her age in front of guests!
In the 1980s, the banana industry's old foe reappeared.
we must meet the common foe!
Over the last few decades bees have seen an invasion of very dangerous foes.
words.defineEn: an opponent or enemy
words.defineVi: một đối thủ hoặc kẻ thù

examples: But for a long time, these optical mark-sensing machines were very picky.
She’s picky.
This crab is a picky dresser.
As a result, these cockroaches are not picky eaters.
They're very picky dressers.
words.defineEn: extremely careful with their choices and hard to please
words.defineVi: cực kỳ cẩn thận với sự lựa chọn của họ và khó hài lòng

examples: There is certainly no shortage of resentment in the rest of Asia about the way China throws its weight about these days.
And Dexter tried to calm his faint resentment against her for casting a shadow over his optimistic mood.
In Oklahoma the resentment was particularly strong.
That adds more resentment to his feelings around Sochi.
There's a great deal of resentment about the economic shape of the country.
words.defineEn: the feeling of anger and dissatisfaction because one thinks something is unfair
words.defineVi: cảm giác tức giận và không hài lòng vì một người nghĩ rằng điều gì đó là không công bằng
